title: Samsung Galaxy S10+ vs Samsung Galaxy S10E â€” A month later!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: - Hey guys, it's Justine, and today we're doing a follow-up video to my S10+ unboxing review, and my day with the S10+. And we've got a new little friend here, this is the S10e. I'm sure you guys have seen a bunch of videos, and I've also watched a bunch of videos covering both of these phones, and there's been so many great reviews of the S10e, that I needed to check it out for myself. A huge thank you to Metro by T-Mobile for partnering with me on this video. I've been on their network since my trip to New York last year. And since then, their network has been there for me, on the road, through all my travels, and again, through these upcoming few weeks, while I'll be traveling some more. This is also really exciting and such a perfect fit for this video because Metro now has some of the Samsung Galaxy S10 phones in their line-up. It's really great that Metro has these flagship devices because these tend to be a little expensive. But you'll be saving so much with your Metro plan, that it ends up paying for itself. You can get an unlimited high speed data plan for four lines for $30 per line. So now, it's time to unbox, set up, and take these guys outside. This is the prism white. Whoa, it's so beautiful. I thought that I was really into the ceramic, but look at this. I'm not sure if you can tell, but it's so pretty. And just like in the previous unboxing, we've got all of the same goodies, charging brick, dongle, USB. (phone beeps) Whoa, hello. And now, for the S10e, I'm so excited about this little phone. It's crazy how powerful this thing still is. Oh, you're so, I'm so excited. It actually matches my outfit, it matches perfectly. Look at that, I accessorize my phones to my outfits. (giggles) The S10e comes in two different configurations. There's the six gigs of RAM, with 128 gigs of storage, and the eight gigs of RAM with 256 gigs of storage. The battery life on the S10e is 3,100 milliamps, whereas the S10+ is 4,100 milliamps. Both of these phones can take an SD card, so you can expand the storage up to 512 gigs, which I feel like is a lot of storage, especially because I feel like most people store things on the clouds now, the clouds, multiple clouds (laughs) And of the front you'll notice that the S10E only has one camera, and the S10+ has two. So, the two cameras on the front of the S10+, one is actually just for depth, so you'll be able to get better portrait mode photos, and the S10E only has one. Obviously the S10+ has a much bigger screen. This is a 6.4 inch AMOLED display, and the S10e is only a 5.8 inch. - [Phone Voice] Let's look at the terms and conditions. - Google, we're looking, we're looking, okay - you can restore settings and contents from. - Okay. The fingerprint sensor in the S10e is actually located on the power button, which I almost like this placement better than the in-screen fingerprint reader, because I feel like when I'm picking up my phone, I'm just gonna go like this anyway. But as some of you are probably wondering about my S10+ fingerprint dilemma that I was having, and then I did the update the Samsung had, and it worked so much better. I also ended up adding several of my fingerprints. So, since then, things have been working out quite well. I'm not gonna lie, I think I actually like this placement better. Now that both of my phones are set up, I'm gonna take these guys out and take them for a little test. I really like this prism white. It's so pretty, it's super holographic. One of the other cool things is you can wirelessly share power, which is so freaking cool. I showed you guys this in my previous review, but, I just needed to share with you again. Do you need to charge your phone? Well, you can charge your phone with my phone. (phone bleeps) Ooh. You can also charge anything that's T-wireless compatible. So, you could even charge your AirPods, which is insane, if they're the new AirPods, that is. (phone beeping) We've got both of our phones set up. We've got the S10e, the S10+. I just can't get over this prism. It's a beautiful holographic look. Now I have to set up our little rig here. So, the way that I usually do this, is I just get this little tripod, and then I put this little mounting bracket on, and these are little noble clamps, that you just put your phone in, super easy. This is what I use for all of my videos, whenever I'm doing cell phone tests. What's great is, if I put them this way, then, both of the lenses are sort of in a very similar location.
